events.originalText: U.S. Air Force carried out an airstrike in Al-Baghuz Fawqani killing 64 civilians.
events.subtitle: 2019 U.S. airstrike in Baghuz
events.headline: U.S. Air Force airstrike in Al-Baghuz Fawqani kills 64 civilians

events.originalText: As per a court order, the feeding tube of Terri Schiavo, an American woman who suffered brain damage, was removed at the request of her husband, fueling a worldwide debate on euthanasia.
events.subtitle: Court order
events.headline: Terri Schiavo's feeding tube removed, sparking euthanasia debate

events.originalText: The deadliest fire in Philippine history broke out at a nightclub in Quezon City, causing 162 deaths.
events.subtitle: Ozone Disco fire
events.headline: Deadliest fire in Philippine history at Quezon City nightclub, 162 dead

events.originalText: Unidentified thieves stole thirteen works of art collectively valued at $500 million from the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum (pictured) in Boston, Massachusetts.
events.subtitle: Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum theft
events.headline: Thieves steal $500 million worth of art from Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum

events.originalText: The first episode of the soap opera Neighbours was broadcast on the Seven Network, later becoming the longest-running drama in Australian television history.
events.subtitle: Soap opera
events.headline: Neighbours soap opera premieres on Seven Network, sets Australian TV record

events.originalText: The punk group the Clash released their first single, "White Riot", described as their "most controversial song".
events.subtitle: The Clash
events.headline: The Clash releases controversial single 'White Riot'

events.originalText: U.S. postal workers began an eight-day strike after Congress  raised their wages by only 4 percent despite increasing its own pay by 41 percent.
events.subtitle: 1970 United States postal strike
events.headline: U.S. postal workers strike over wage increase discrepancy

events.originalText: Vietnam War: The United States began secretly bombing the Sihanouk Trail in Cambodia, used by communist forces to infiltrate South Vietnam.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: U.S. secretly bombs Sihanouk Trail in Cambodia during Vietnam War

events.originalText: Cosmonaut Alexei Leonov ventured outside the Soviet spacecraft Voskhod 2, becoming the first person to walk in space.
events.subtitle: Alexei Leonov
events.headline: Cosmonaut Alexei Leonov first person to walk in space

events.originalText: Chinese forces began a bombardment of Sera Monastery in Lhasa, Tibet, inflicting severe destruction and killing hundreds of Buddhist monks.
events.subtitle: Sera Monastery
events.headline: Chinese forces bombard Sera Monastery in Lhasa, Tibet, killing hundreds

events.originalText: Mexican president Lázaro Cárdenas issued a decree expropriating foreign-owned oil reserves and facilities, which were later incorporated into Pemex, a state-owned petroleum company.
events.subtitle: Lázaro Cárdenas
events.headline: Mexican president expropriates foreign-owned oil reserves

events.originalText: Russian Civil War: Bolshevik forces suppressed a rebellion of sailors and civilians in Kronstadt.
events.subtitle: Russian Civil War
events.headline: Bolshevik forces suppress rebellion in Kronstadt during Russian Civil War

events.originalText: First World War: In one of the largest naval battles of the Gallipoli campaign, Ottoman forces sank three Allied battleships and severely damaged three others.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Ottoman forces sink three Allied battleships in Gallipoli naval battle

events.originalText: Romanian inventor Traian Vuia became the first person to fly a heavier-than-air monoplane (pictured) with an unassisted takeoff.
events.subtitle: Traian Vuia
events.headline: Traian Vuia flies first heavier-than-air monoplane with unassisted takeoff

events.originalText: Canadian governor general Lord Stanley of Preston pledged to donate an award to Canada's top-ranked amateur ice hockey club, now known as the Stanley Cup, the oldest professional sports trophy in North America.
events.subtitle: Frederick Stanley, 16th Earl of Derby
events.headline: Lord Stanley of Preston pledges award for top amateur ice hockey club

events.originalText: Charles I of Anjou acquired a claim on the Kingdom of Jerusalem in exchange for a significant sum of money.
events.subtitle: Charles I of Anjou
events.headline: Charles I of Anjou acquires claim on Kingdom of Jerusalem

events.originalText: First Mongol invasion of Poland: Mongol forces defeated the Polish armies of Sandomierz and Kraków at the Battle of Chmielnik.
events.subtitle: First Mongol invasion of Poland
events.headline: Mongol forces defeat Polish armies at Battle of Chmielnik

events.originalText: A fire in Rome begins, leading to the destruction of the Temple of Apollo Palatinus.
events.subtitle: Temple of Apollo Palatinus
events.headline: Fire in Rome destroys Temple of Apollo Palatinus
